header.title: The Occult Encyclopedia of Magick Squares Volume 1: Planetary Angels and Spirits of Ceremonial Magick

central_thesis: This book presents magic squares not as mere mathematical curiosities, but as numerical representations of profound cosmic principles that act as conduits for spiritual forces. It provides specific, pre-calculated magic squares and a detailed system of numerological and elemental correspondences, enabling practitioners to connect with over 160 distinct spiritual beings (planetary angels, jinn, zodiacal spirits) for spiritual evolution and material manifestation through ceremonial magic.

structure_content.summary: Introduces the book's premise: magic squares are 'private phone calling cards' to attract spiritual power, sharply contrasting with secular scientific views. It highlights the book's unique contribution in providing precise numerological 'dialing codes' for numerous spiritual entities, promising tangible benefits and spiritual evolution.

Defines 'Kamea' (Hebrew) and 'al-Wifeq' (Arabic) as terms for magic squares. Explains the structural requirements of a magic square and categorizes them into Numerical, Alphabetical Numerical, Alphabetical, and Alphanumerical types, detailing their magical applications. Introduces Pythagorean reduction as a method for understanding the metaphysical nature of numbers (1-9) and discusses elemental attributes (Fire, Air, Water, Earth) as a directional component of squares. It also addresses historical discrepancies in ancient manuscripts, noting the author's chosen astrological elemental arrangement for consistency.

Explores the traditional associations between the seven classical planets and specific magic square sizes (e.g., Saturn 3x3, Jupiter 4x4). It discusses modern astrological recognition of additional planets and how ancient practitioners would have assigned larger squares, emphasizing the author's decision to provide all possible squares up to 10x10 for various planetary and sub-planetary forces.

structure_content.chapter_title: MAGIC SQUARES AND MYSTICISM OF NUMBERS
structure_content.summary: Delves into the metaphysical significance of numbers 1-9, explaining how they are woven into ancient cosmology and represent divine order. It introduces the concept of Pythagorean reduction to analyze the esoteric numbers derived from magic squares, revealing recurring patterns (1 and 9) that symbolize the beginning and end of cycles, and linking them to divine harmony.

structure_content.chapter_title: ANGELS AND JINN OF THE MAGIC SQUARES
structure_content.summary: Reveals the core operative system: each magic square is linked to 8 angelic and 8 jinn beings whose names' numerological values are found within the square's calculated numbers. It outlines how these numbers (derived from first/last number, sums of rows/total square) correspond to different 'titles' of spiritual beings (e.g., Usurper, Guide, Adjuster, Leader, Regulator, General Governor, High Overseer), enabling specific evocations for constructive or material manifestation purposes.

Provides an overview of practical benefits of magic squares, categorized by planetary and zodiacal influences (e.g., Saturn for overcoming delays, Jupiter for honors, Mars for bravery, Sun for fame, Venus for love, Mercury for communication, Moon for popularity). It explains how to tailor talismans for specific purposes, combining planetary and angelic/jinn energies, and suggests a personal income-growth square as an example.

structure_content.chapter_title: ARIES, TAURUS, GEMINI, CANCER, LEO, VIRGO, LIBRA, SCORPIO, SAGITTARIUS, CAPRICORN, AQUARIUS, PISCES, SATURN, JUPITER, MARS, SUN, VENUS, MERCURY, MOON
structure_content.summary: These chapters provide pre-calculated magic squares for the angels and spirits associated with each zodiacal sign and planet. Each section includes various elemental variations of the squares (Fire, Earth, Air, Water) and comprehensive numerological data (Angel/Jinn values in Arabic and Hebrew) for various magical titles (Usurper, Guide, Mystery, Adjuster, Leader, Regulator, General Governor, High Overseer).

key_concepts.definition: Ancient Hebrew and Arabic terms, respectively, for magic squares, meaning talisman or amulet. The author uses them to emphasize the magical, rather than purely mathematical, nature of these constructs.

A grid of numbers (minimum 3x3) where the sum of numbers in each row, column, and main diagonal is identical. The author views them as numerical illustrations of cosmic principles and direct magnets for spiritual forces, rather than mere mathematical curiosities.

A numerological technique used to reduce any number to a single digit (1-9) by summing its constituent digits recursively (e.g., 666 -> 18 -> 9). This method is applied to esoteric numbers derived from magic squares to reveal deeper metaphysical meanings.

The classification of magic squares by association with one of the four elements (Fire, Air, Water, Earth), determined by the internal numbering direction of the square. This attribution influences the square's magical properties and is crucial for specific workings.

Raw plates are general magic square patterns (e.g., the 3x3 Saturn square) representing the pure essence of a planet. Specific squares are derived from these raw plates by incorporating numerological values of particular spiritual beings (angels, jinn) or intentions, making them laser-focused for targeted magical work.

A unique system where 8 angelic and 8 jinn beings (representing different magical 'titles' like Usurper, Guide, Leader) are associated with each magic square. These associations are established by matching specific numbers derived from the square's construction (e.g., first/last number, sums of lines/total square) to the numerological values of the beings' names.

Beyond the traditional seven planetary squares (3x3 for Saturn, 4x4 for Jupiter, etc.), the author extends associations to larger square sizes (up to 10x10) to encompass additional or 'sub-planetary' forces, and to accommodate numerological values that do not fit smaller grids.

practical_system.description: The practical system revolves around creating talismans using specific magic squares designed to 'dial' particular spiritual beings (angels, jinn) or forces. These squares are selected based on the numerological value of the desired entity's name and its astrological/elemental correspondences. The system emphasizes handmade talismans on natural materials, imbued with intention through chanting, breathing, and visualization.
tools: Natural paper, leather, or cloth (for the talisman)
Knowledge of Hebrew/Arabic alphabets and their numerological values (for advanced customization, though pre-calculated squares are provided)
rituals: Drawing a large infinity symbol on natural material (paper, leather, or cloth).
Chanting specific names (e.g., Nathan Sha'al Aosher Kabowd Aiysh Melek Yowm) or corresponding English phrases while drawing.
In the top/right loop of the infinity symbol, drawing an 8x8 square composed solely of a Hebrew letter (e.g., Cheth for the number eight) while reciting divine names (e.g., Chesed, Chamal, Chai).
In the bottom/left loop, drawing the specific numerical magic square for the targeted spiritual being or purpose.
Audibly pronouncing the words of the squares from right to left while drawing.
Visualizing the letters/numbers glowing with a white hue filled with golden sparkles.
Wrapping the completed talisman in a white cloth and placing it in one's wallet.

Periodically retracing the inscription with fingers and chanting, particularly when planetary influences (e.g., the Moon re-entering the 8th degree of Virgo for an income-growth talisman) are favorable.

relevant_quotes.text: What this book will give you that no other English book has given you before is the precise numbers to dial.
In this cosmic view, magic squares are numerical illustrations of deep cosmic principles. They are magnets to spiritual forces.
All the squares provided to you in this book are specific in nature. This will save you a tremendous amount of time in calculating ones you may need for your occult working.
Eight angelic beings made of light and eight jinn beings made of smokeless fire are associated with every single magic square.

critical_analysis.relevance: This book is highly relevant for serious practitioners of ceremonial magic, Qabalah, and Hermeticism who seek a detailed and actionable system for working with magic squares. It transcends mere theoretical discussion by offering hundreds of pre-calculated, 'specific' squares and a structured methodology for their application, addressing a common gap in much esoteric literature that focuses only on general patterns. Its emphasis on numerological precision and elemental attributions for specific spiritual entities provides a novel and powerful framework for operative magic, moving beyond generalized planetary talismans.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience includes experienced practitioners of the sacred magical arts, Kabbalists, Hermeticists, and students of the Golden Dawn system and its offshoots. It is also for 'serious seekers' of any magical tradition looking to understand and apply magic squares for spiritual evolution, material manifestation, and various practical purposes such as improving communication, relationships, health, and professional success.
